## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 719, 448]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 448, 325, 463]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 463, 504, 479]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 479, 504, 494]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 494, 384, 509]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 526, 255, 541]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 541, 653, 557]]<|/det|>
If working is needed for any question it must be shown below that question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 557, 384, 572]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators should be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 572, 905, 603]]<|/det|>
If the degree of accuracy is not specified in the question, and if the answer is not exact, give the answer to three significant figures. Give answers in degrees to one decimal place.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 447, 618]]<|/det|>
For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 604, 650]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 759, 666]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 405, 681]]<|/det|>
The total of the marks for this paper is 70.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 348, 88]]<|/det|> Simon has two boxes of cards. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 737, 104]]<|/det|> In one box, each card has one shape drawn on it that is either a triangle or a square. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 544, 120]]<|/det|> In the other box, each card is coloured either red or blue. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 460, 151]]<|/det|> Simon picks a card from each box at random. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 149, 460, 166]]<|/det|> The probability of picking a triangle card is \(t\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 164, 425, 182]]<|/det|> The probability of picking a red card is \(r\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 196, 818, 213]]<|/det|> Complete the table for the cards that Simon picks, writing each probability in terms of \(r\) and \(t\). <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 222, 707, 386]]<|/det|>
EventProbability
Triangle and red
Square and red(1 - t)r
Triangle and blue
Square and blue
